title: How to Run NASM on Windows

steps.title: Download codeblocks from Code Blocks Downloads.
steps.content: Download codeblocks from Code Blocks Downloads .

steps.title: Install the codeblocks by running the setup.
steps.content: Install the codeblocks by running the setup. exe file you downloaded.

steps.title: Extract and install nasm into the codeblocks folder, e.g.
steps.content: Extract and install nasm into the codeblocks folder, e.g. , C:\Program Files\CodeBlocks\MinGW\bin.

steps.title: Check whether the installation is working or not by the source code below for a test run.
steps.content: Check whether the installation is working or not by the source code below for a test run. This is a Win32 console program that writes "Hello, World" on one line and; then exits. It needs to be linked with a C library.

steps.title: Save the source code above as helloworld.
steps.content: Save the source code above as helloworld. asm in the location: C:\Program Files\CodeBlocks\MinGW\bin.

steps.title: Run nasmpath.
steps.content: Run nasmpath. bat. Enter this command: nasm -f win32 helloworld.asm. It should produce a helloworld.obj file in the same directory.

steps.title: Execute the object file by typing:
steps.content: Execute the object file by typing: gcc helloworld.obj. It should build a file named a.exe.

steps.title: Type a.exe to run the test program and get your result.
steps.content: Type a.exe to run the test program and get your result. The words "Hello, World" should display on the screen.
